com.pump.plaf

Class NavigationPanelUI.NumberSpinnerDescriptor

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.pump.plaf.NavigationPanelUI.SpinnerDescriptor
      • com.pump.plaf.NavigationPanelUI.NumberSpinnerDescriptor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.util.concurrent.Callable<java.lang.String>
    Enclosing class:
    NavigationPanelUI

    public static class NavigationPanelUI.NumberSpinnerDescriptor
extends NavigationPanelUI.SpinnerDescriptor
    This describes SpinnerNumberModels. Here we have a min and a max, so we can say something like: "Page 5 of 10". To do this you'll have to specify the word "Page" during construction.

    However if we just have a generic SpinnerModel: then there's no telling where the min/max is. In that case this just converts the spinner's current value to a String.

      • NumberSpinnerDescriptor

        public NumberSpinnerDescriptor(javax.swing.JSpinner spinner,
                               java.lang.String word,
                               int incr)
        Create a new DefaultDescriptor.
        Parameters:
        spinner - the spinner this applies to.
        word - in the expression "Page 5 of 10" this argument is "Page"
        incr - an optional amount to increment spinner values by. For example if a model ranges from [0, 99] and this value is 1, then the text will present this model as ranging from [1,100]

      • NumberSpinnerDescriptor

        public NumberSpinnerDescriptor(javax.swing.SpinnerNumberModel numberModel,
                               java.lang.String word,
                               int incr)
        Create a new DefaultDescriptor.
        Parameters:
        numberModel - the number model to consult.
        word - in the expression "Page 5 of 10" this argument is "Page"
        incr - an optional amount to increment spinner values by. For example if a model ranges from [0, 99] and this value is 1, then the text will present this model as ranging from [1,100]
